info.title: HashiCorp Resource Manager Service
info.description: API for managing organizations, projects, and listing resources within projects.

get.summary: GetIamPolicy gets the IAM policy for a resource.

parameters.name: resource_name
parameters.description: ResourceName is the resource name of the resource. Either this or the ResourceId needs to be provided.

parameters.name: resource_id
parameters.description: ResourceId is the resource name of the resource. Either this or the ResourceName needs to be provided.

put.summary:
SetIamPolicy sets the IAM policy for a resource. Since this updates the full policy, the policy takes an "etag"
argument that should match with the current policy stored in the system. This is to avoid concurrent writes erasing each other's data.
Hence, the client should always get the current policy that includes the etag, modify the policy and then set the policy with the same etag.
If there is no existing policy the etag must be empty.

post.summary: BatchTestIamPermissions allows for a batch of TestIamPermissions requests to be made in a single call.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: BatchAuthorizationTestIamPermissionsRequest is a request to test a set of permissions for multiple resources.

post.summary: TestIamPermissions returns a subset of the request permissions the calling principal has for the authorization context.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: AuthorizationTestIamPermissionsRequest is a request to test a set of permissions.

get.summary: List lists the organizations the caller has access to.

parameters.name: pagination.page_size
parameters.description:
The max number of results per page that should be returned. If the number
of available results is larger than `page_size`, a `next_page_token` is
returned which can be used to get the next page of results in subsequent
requests. A value of zero will cause `page_size` to be defaulted.

parameters.name: pagination.next_page_token
parameters.description:
Specifies a page token to use to retrieve the next page. Set this to the
`next_page_token` returned by previous list requests to get the next page of
results. If set, `previous_page_token` must not be set.

parameters.name: pagination.previous_page_token
parameters.description:
Specifies a page token to use to retrieve the previous page. Set this to
the `previous_page_token` returned by previous list requests to get the
previous page of results. If set, `next_page_token` must not be set.

post.summary:
Warning! Internal use only. Create creates a new organization. The owner is set to the identity of the
caller. An organization can not be owned by a machine account.

get.summary: Get retrieves the requested organization by ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID is the identifier of the organization to retrieve.

get.summary: GetIamPolicy retrieves the requested organization's IAM policy.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID is the identifier of the organization.

put.summary:
SetIamPolicy sets the IAM policy for an organization. Since this updates the full policy, the policy takes an "etag"
argument that should match with the current policy stored in the system. This is to avoid concurrent writes erasing each other's data.
Hence, the client should always get the current policy that includes the etag, modify the policy and then set the policy with the same etag.
If there is no existing policy the etag must be empty.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID is the identifier of the organization.

policy.description:
Policy is the updated IAM policy for the organization. The policy
will be completely replaced and therefore Policy.Etag must be specified
in order to prevent concurrent updates.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID is the identifier of the organization.

name.description: Name is the new name of the organization.

get.summary: ListRoles returns a list of all user facing Roles for an organization.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID is the identifier of the organization.

parameters.name: pagination.page_size
parameters.description:
The max number of results per page that should be returned. If the number
of available results is larger than `page_size`, a `next_page_token` is
returned which can be used to get the next page of results in subsequent
requests. A value of zero will cause `page_size` to be defaulted.

parameters.name: pagination.next_page_token
parameters.description:
Specifies a page token to use to retrieve the next page. Set this to the
`next_page_token` returned by previous list requests to get the next page of
results. If set, `previous_page_token` must not be set.

parameters.name: pagination.previous_page_token
parameters.description:
Specifies a page token to use to retrieve the previous page. Set this to
the `previous_page_token` returned by previous list requests to get the
previous page of results. If set, `next_page_token` must not be set.

post.summary: TestIamPermissions returns a subset of the request permissions the calling principal has for the organization.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID is the identifier of the organization.

get.summary: GetRole returns a Role and its mapped permissions.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID is the identifier of the organization.

parameters.name: role_id
parameters.description: RoleId is the identifier of the role to retrieve.

get.summary: List retrieves the projects the caller has access to.

parameters.name: scope.type
parameters.description: ResourceType is the type of object being referenced.

parameters.name: scope.id
parameters.description: id is the id of the object being referenced.

parameters.name: pagination.page_size
parameters.description:
The max number of results per page that should be returned. If the number
of available results is larger than `page_size`, a `next_page_token` is
returned which can be used to get the next page of results in subsequent
requests. A value of zero will cause `page_size` to be defaulted.

parameters.name: pagination.next_page_token
parameters.description:
Specifies a page token to use to retrieve the next page. Set this to the
`next_page_token` returned by previous list requests to get the next page of
results. If set, `previous_page_token` must not be set.

parameters.name: pagination.previous_page_token
parameters.description:
Specifies a page token to use to retrieve the previous page. Set this to
the `previous_page_token` returned by previous list requests to get the
previous page of results. If set, `next_page_token` must not be set.

parameters.name: sorting.order_by
parameters.description:
Specifies the list of per field ordering that should be used for sorting. 
The order matters as rows are sorted in order by fields and when the field
matches, the next field is used to tie break the ordering.
The per field default ordering is ascending.  

The fields should be immutabile, unique, and orderable. If the field is
not unique, more than one sort fields should be passed.

Example: oder_by=name,age desc,created_at asc
In that case, 'name' will get the default 'ascending' order.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Query is the search query to filter the projects.

post.summary:
Warning! Internal use only. Create provisions a new project.
Create is an asynchronous action, meaning that the project creation may not be immediately visible to the client. 
The client should poll the returned operation until it is completed to ensure the project is successfully created.
For more details on polling an operation, consult the [HCP Operations Service /wait endpoint documentation](https://developer.hashicorp.com/hcp/api-docs/operations#Wait).

get.summary: GetProjectsCount returns the count of projects within a parent scope.

parameters.name: scope.type
parameters.description: ResourceType is the type of object being referenced.

parameters.name: scope.id
parameters.description: id is the id of the object being referenced.

get.summary:
Get retrieves the requested project by ID. A not found status will be returned
for projects in the DELETED state.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID is the identifier of the organization to retrieve.

delete.summary:
Warning! Internal use only. Delete updates the state of a project to `DELETED`.
Delete is an asynchronous action, meaning that the project deletion may not be immediately visible to the client.
The client should poll the returned operation until it is completed to ensure the project is successfully deleted.
For more details on polling an operation, consult the [HCP Operations Service /wait endpoint documentation](https://developer.hashicorp.com/hcp/api-docs/operations#Wait).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID is the identifier of the project to delete.

put.summary:
SetDescription updates the requested project's description.
SetDescription is an asynchronous action, meaning that the project update may not be immediately visible to the client.
The client should poll the returned operation until it is completed to ensure the project is successfully updated.
For more details on polling an operation, consult the [HCP Operations Service /wait endpoint documentation](https://developer.hashicorp.com/hcp/api-docs/operations#Wait).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: id is the identifier of the project to update.

description.description: description is the value the project's description should be updated to.

get.summary: GetIamPolicy retrieves the user managed IAM policy for a project.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID is the identifier of the project.

put.summary:
SetIamPolicy updates the IAM policy for a project. Since this updates the full policy, the policy takes an "etag"
argument that should match with the current policy stored in the system. This is to avoid concurrent writes erasing each other's data.
Hence, the client should always get the current policy that includes the etag, modify the policy and then set the policy with the same etag.
If there is no existing policy the etag must be empty.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID is the identifier of the project.

policy.description:
Policy is the IAM policy to be updated for the project. The policy
will be completely replaced and therefore Policy.Etag must be specified
in order to prevent concurrent updates.

put.summary:
SetName updates the requested project's name.
SetName is an asynchronous action, meaning that the project update may not be immediately visible to the client.
The client should poll the returned operation until it is completed to ensure the project is successfully updated.
For more details on polling an operation, consult the [HCP Operations Service /wait endpoint documentation](https://developer.hashicorp.com/hcp/api-docs/operations#Wait).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: id is the identifier of the project to update.

name.description: name is the value the project's name should be updated to.

post.summary: TestIamPermissions returns a subset of the request permissions the calling principal has for the project.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID is the identifier of the project.

parameters.name: resource_id
parameters.description: ResourceId is the unique identifier of the resource.

parameters.name: resource_name
parameters.description: ResourceName is the name of the resource.

get.summary:
ListRoles lists roles applicable on the given resource. Requires caller to have "resource-manager.resource.list-roles"
permission on the given resource.

parameters.name: resource.id

get.summary: ListAccessibleResources lists the resources the caller has access to at and below the given scope.

parameters.name: scope_resource_name
parameters.description:
ScopeResourceName is resource name of the parent object to list resources under.
Either this or the ResourceId needs to be provided.

parameters.name: scope_resource_id
parameters.description:
ScopeResourceId is resource ID of the parent object to list resources under.
Either this or the ResourceName needs to be provided.

parameters.name: resource_type
parameters.description: ResourceType is the resource type of the resources to list.

parameters.name: permission
parameters.description: Permission is the permission to check.

parameters.name: leaf_name_filter
parameters.description:
LeafNameFilter optionally allows for filtering results based on a
substring match of the final/leaf name within the resource's resource
name.

parameters.name: pagination.page_size

of available results is larger than `page_size`, a `next_page_token` is
returned which can be used to get the next page of results in subsequent
requests. A value of zero will cause `page_size` to be defaulted.

post.summary: TestIamPermissions returns a subset of the request permissions the calling principal has on the resource.

@type.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com. As of May 2023, there are no widely used type server
implementations and no plans to implement one.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

code.description:
The status code, which should be an enum value of
[google.rpc.Code][google.rpc.Code].

message.description:
A developer-facing error message, which should be in English. Any
user-facing error message should be localized and sent in the
[google.rpc.Status.details][google.rpc.Status.details] field, or localized
by the client.

details.description:
A list of messages that carry the error details.  There is a common set of
message types for APIs to use.

google.rpc.Status.description:
The `Status` type defines a logical error model that is suitable for
different programming environments, including REST APIs and RPC APIs. It is
used by [gRPC](https://github.com/grpc). Each `Status` message contains
three pieces of data: error code, error message, and error details.

You can find out more about this error model and how to work with it in the
[API Design Guide](https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/errors).

page_size.description:
The max number of results per page that should be returned. If the number
of available results is larger than `page_size`, a `next_page_token` is
returned which can be used to get the next page of results in subsequent
requests. A value of zero will cause `page_size` to be defaulted.

next_page_token.description:
Specifies a page token to use to retrieve the next page. Set this to the
`next_page_token` returned by previous list requests to get the next page of
results. If set, `previous_page_token` must not be set.

previous_page_token.description:
Specifies a page token to use to retrieve the previous page. Set this to
the `previous_page_token` returned by previous list requests to get the
previous page of results. If set, `next_page_token` must not be set.

hashicorp.cloud.common.PaginationRequest.description: PaginationRequest are the parameters for a paginated list request.

next_page_token.description:
This token allows you to get the next page of results for list requests.
If the number of results is larger than `page_size`, use the
`next_page_token` as a value for the query parameter `next_page_token` in
the next request. The value will become empty when there are no more pages.

previous_page_token.description:
This token allows you to get the previous page of results for list
requests. If the number of results is larger than `page_size`, use the
`previous_page_token` as a value for the query parameter
`previous_page_token` in the next request. The value will become empty when
there are no more pages.

hashicorp.cloud.common.PaginationRespons.description:
PaginationResponse is the response holding the page tokens for a paginated
list response.

order_by.description:
Specifies the list of per field ordering that should be used for sorting. 
The order matters as rows are sorted in order by fields and when the field
matches, the next field is used to tie break the ordering.
The per field default ordering is ascending.  

The fields should be immutabile, unique, and orderable. If the field is
not unique, more than one sort fields should be passed.

Example: oder_by=name,age desc,created_at asc
In that case, 'name' will get the default 'ascending' order.

hashicorp.cloud.common.SortingRequest.description: SortingRequest are the parameters for a sorted list request.

type.description:
type is the unique type of the resource. Each service publishes a
unique set of types. The type value is recommended to be formatted
in "<org>.<type>" such as "hashicorp.hvn". This is to prevent conflicts
in the future, but any string value will work.

id.description: id is the identifier for this resource.

uuid.description: uuid is the unique UUID for this resource.

location.description: location is the location where this resource is.

description.description:
description is a human-friendly description for this link. This is
used primarily for informational purposes such as error messages.

hashicorp.cloud.location.Link.description:
Link is used to uniquely reference any resource within HashiCorp Cloud.
This can be conceptually considered a "foreign key".

organization_id.description: organization_id is the id of the organization.

region.description:
region is the region that the resource is located in. It is
optional if the object being referenced is a global object.

hashicorp.cloud.location.Location.description: Location represents a target for an operation in HCP.

provider.title: provider is the named cloud provider ("aws", "gcp", "azure")

hashicorp.cloud.location.Region.description: Region identifies a Cloud data-plane region.

id.description:
id is the unique ID for this operation used in other RPC calls.
This ID is only guaranteed to be unique within the region that
the operation is running in.

state.description:
state is the current state of the operation. This is a simple tri-state:
PENDING means the operation is created but not yet started, RUNNING means
the operation is currently running (though it may be very long-running),
and DONE means the operation is complete whether successfully or not.

error.description: error is the error that occurred in the operation.

response.description:
response is the result of the operation. See the documentation for the API
call creating the operation to understand what the value of this is.

location.description: Location is location of the resource that this operation belongs to.

link.description: Link is the resource link the operation is associated with.

created_at.description: CreatedAt is the timestamp of when the operation was first created.

updated_at.description: UpdatedAt is the timestamp of when the operation was last updated.

hashicorp.cloud.operation.Operation.Stat.description:
State is one of the states that an Operation can be in.

The states are purposely coarse grained to make it easy to understand
the operation state machine: pending => running => done. Or pending =>
queued => running => done. No other state transitions are possible.
Success/failure can be determined based on the result oneof.

permissions.description: Permissions is the set of permissions to test.

resource_id.description:
ResourceId holds the unique, immutable and non-reusable ID of the resource.

Example formats include:
  - vault.cluster:t79BRg8WhTmDPBRM
  - vagrant.box:gTmD2KMMRt9DWhJz

resource_name.description:
ResourceName holds the Resource Name in the Resource Identifier v2 format.
This parameter is expected to be provided only for external calls.

Example formats include:
  - vault/project/e1e04e11-d590-41cf-b818-1535bc4b4889/cluster/my-cluster
  - vagrant/organization/ubuntu/box/lunar64/version/v20230130.0.0
  - iam/organization/zBmk8k7Pk99ph7Kr/service-principal/my-sp-43563412
  - consul/project/e57a01aa-1929-40e8-80b8-4907fc46429c/cluster/my-cluster

In case of organization or project level authorization the ResourceName is
expected to be provided in the following format:
  - organization/863063b6-c485-4cf4-8df3-6991a2ffd4b4
  - project/e1e04e11-d590-41cf-b818-1535bc4b4889
  - project/gTmD2KMMRt9DWhJz

hashicorp.cloud.resourcemanager.Authoriz.description: AuthorizationTestIamPermissionsRequest is a request to test a set of permissions.

allowed_permissions.description:
AllowedPermissions is the set of permissions granted.
It is a subset of AuthorizationTestIamPermissionsRequest.Permissions.

hashicorp.cloud.resourcemanager.Authoriz.description: AuthorizationTestIamPermissionsResponse is the set of granted permissions for the AuthorizationTestIamPermissionsRequest.

resources.description: resources is the list of resources to test with a set of permissions.

hashicorp.cloud.resourcemanager.BatchAut.description: BatchAuthorizationTestIamPermissionsRequest is a request to test a set of permissions for multiple resources.

resource_permissions.title:
resource_permissions is a map of resource_id and/or resource_name to the granted permissions.
The key is determined by whether or not the resource_id/resource_name is a non-empty string.
Take for example the following psuedo-code:

hashicorp.cloud.resourcemanager.BatchAut.description: BatchAuthorizationTestIamPermissionsResponse is the set of granted permissions for multiple resources.

resource_id.description: ResourceId is the ID of the registered resource.

resource_name.description: ResourceName is the name of the registered resource.

resource_type.description: ResourceType is the type of the registered resource.

parent_id.description: ParentId is the ID of the parent of the registered resource.

hashicorp.cloud.resourcemanager.GetResou.title: GetResourceResponse is the response for GetResource RPC

roles.title: Roles is list of roles applicable on the resource

pagination.description: Pagination contains the pagination tokens for a subsequent request.

id.description: ID is an UUID identifying the Organization object.

name.description: Name is the user settable name of the organization.

owner.description:
Owner is the contact for support issue that may occur at the
organization level. Further, if the organization owner is
deleted, the organization itself will be deleted.

created_at.description: CreatedAt is the time the organization was created at.

state.description: State is the state of the organization.

tfc_synced.description: TfcSynced is true if this organization has synced to TFC.

hashicorp.cloud.resourcemanager.Organiza.description:
Organization is the root node in the resource hierarchy. All resources for an
entity reside under the organization.
OrganizationState is the states the organization can be in.

name.description:
Name is the user settable name of the organization. Will default to
"<Principal's name>'s Organization" if unset.

organization.description: Organization is the newly created organization.

policy.description: Policy is the IAM policy for the organization.

organizations.description: Organizations is the organizations the caller has access to.

pagination.description: Pagination contains the pagination tokens for a subsequent request.

roles.description: Roles contains a page of the provisioned roles for the requested organization.

pagination.description: Pagination contains the pagination tokens for a subsequent request.

user.description: User is the user principal id of the owner.

hashicorp.cloud.resourcemanager.Organiza.description: OrganizationOwner identifies the user who owns the organization.

policy.description: Policy is the updated IAM policy for the organization.

organization.description: Organization is the specified organization with an updated name.

allowed_permissions.description: AllowedPermissions are a subset of the request permissions the calling principal has for the organization.

bindings.description: Bindings is a list of role to members for this policy.

etag.description: Etag identifies this version of the policy.

hashicorp.cloud.resourcemanager.Policy.title:
Policy binds many instances of roles to member lists in the resource hierarchy.
For example:

role_id.title:
RoleId is the globally unique identifier for the role.
e.g. projects/30788e25-a942-470a-9a75-128cc7b97fde/roles/my-custom-project-role

members.description: Members is a set of identities that are associated with the role.

hashicorp.cloud.resourcemanager.PolicyBi.description: PolicyBinding binds a list of members to a role.

member_type.description: MemberType is the type of the member.

member_id.description: MemberId is the unique identifier for the member.

hashicorp.cloud.resourcemanager.PolicyBi.description: PolicyBindingMember represents an identity associated with a policy binding.
PolicyBindingMemberType is the type of the policy binding member.

id.description: ID is an UUID identifying the project object.

name.description: Name is the user settable name of the project.

parent.description: Parent is the parent resource of the project.

created_at.description: CreatedAt is the time the project was created at.

state.description: State is the state of the project.

description.description: Description is the user settable description of the project.

hashicorp.cloud.resourcemanager.Project.description: Project is a container for resources.

hashicorp.cloud.resourcemanager.Project..description: ProjectState is the states the project can be in.

name.description: Name is the user settable name of the project.

parent.description: Parent is the parent resource to nest the new project under.

description.description: Description is the user settable description of the project.

project.description: Project is the newly created project.

operation_id.description:
operation_id is the ID of the operation that represents the async creation of the project.
The client should poll the returned operation until it is completed.
For more details on polling an operation, consult the [HCP Operations Service /wait endpoint documentation](https://developer.hashicorp.com/hcp/api-docs/operations#Wait).

operation.description:
operation is the operation that represents the async delete.
The client should poll the returned operation until it is completed.
For more details on polling an operation, consult the [HCP Operations Service /wait endpoint documentation](https://developer.hashicorp.com/hcp/api-docs/operations#Wait).

policy.description: Policy is the system managed IAM policy for the project.

count.description: Count is the count of projects belonging to a parent scope.

projects.description: Projects is the projects the caller has access to at the requested scope.

pagination.description: Pagination contains the pagination tokens for a subsequent request.

operation_id.description:
operation_id is the operation that represents the async update of the project description.
The client should poll the returned operation until it is completed.
For more details on polling an operation, consult the [HCP Operations Service /wait endpoint documentation](https://developer.hashicorp.com/hcp/api-docs/operations#Wait).

policy.description: Policy is the updated IAM policy for the project.

operation_id.description:
operation_id is the operation that represents the async update of the project name.
The client should poll the returned operation until it is completed.
For more details on polling an operation, consult the [HCP Operations Service /wait endpoint documentation](https://developer.hashicorp.com/hcp/api-docs/operations#Wait).

allowed_permissions.description: AllowedPermissions are a subset of the request permissions the calling principal has for the project.

link.description:
Link is a link to the resource. This includes the organization
and project ID as well as the ID of the resource itself.

resource_name.description:
ResourceName is the name of the resource. This is only available on
List responses and is not valid for any creation or update requests.

resource_id.description:
ResourceID is the ID of the resource. This is only available on List
responses and is not valid for any creation or update requests.

geo.description:
Geo is the geography where the resource is registered. A resource MAY NOT
have a geography associated with it. The currently valid values are: "",
"us", and "eu".  This is only available on List responses and is not valid
for any creation or update requests.

policy.description: Policy is the system managed IAM policy for the resource.

type.description: ResourceType is the type of object being referenced.

id.description: id is the id of the object being referenced.

hashicorp.cloud.resourcemanager.Resource.description: ResourceID is a reference to an object in the resource hierarchy.

name.description: Name is the resource name of the resource.

id.description: Id is the resource id of the resource.

hashicorp.cloud.resourcemanager.Resource.description: ResourceIdentifier identifies a resource by either its name or id.

resources.description: Resources is the resources the caller has access to at the requested scope and of the requested type.

pagination.description: Pagination contains the pagination tokens for a subsequent request.

resources.description: Resources is the resources the caller has access to at the requested scope.

pagination.description: Pagination contains the pagination tokens for a subsequent request.

resource_name.description: ResourceName is the resource name of the resource. Either this or the ResourceId needs to be provided.

resource_id.description: ResourceId is the resource name of the resource. Either this or the ResourceName needs to be provided.

policy.description:
Policy is the IAM policy to be updated for the resource. The policy
will be completely replaced and therefore Policy.Etag must be specified
in order to prevent concurrent updates.
Policy is the updated IAM policy for the resource.

resource.description: resource is the scope of the permissions that is going to be retrieved.

allowed_permissions.description: AllowedPermissions are a subset of the request permissions the calling principal has for the resource.

resource_name.description: ResourceName is the name of the resource.

resource_id.description: ResourceID is the ID of the resource.

geo.description:
Geo is the geography where the resource is registered. A resource MAY NOT
have a geography associated with it. The currently valid values are: "",
"us", and "eu".

hashicorp.cloud.resourcemanager.Resource.description: ResourceV2 is a container for resource v2 identifiers.

id.title:
ID is the globally unique identifier for this role.
Examples:
* roles/contributor
* organizations/30788e25-a942-470a-9a75-128cc7b97fde/roles/my-custom-role (custom role scoped to an organization)
* projects/30788e25-a942-470a-9a75-128cc7b97fde/roles/my-custom-project-role

version.description:
Version is the instance of this role - version is incremented when a
permission is added or removed and when other metadata is changed.

title.description: Title is a display name for this role.

description.description: Description provides information regarding the purpose of this role.

permissions.title:
Permissions is a set of allowed permissions in the format: <service>.<noun>.<action>
Examples:
* network.hvns.create
* network.hvns.read
* consul.clusters.create

lowest_applicable_resource_types.title:
LowestApplicableResourceTypes is a list of lowest applicable resource types that this role should be assigned to.
The parent resource types will be deduced by the Resource Manager.
The list should contain valid resource types in the format hashicorp.<service>.<resource>
Examples:
* hashicorp.resource-manager.project
* hashicorp.secrets.app

hashicorp.cloud.resourcemanager.Role.description: Role binds a name to a set of permissions.

bearer.description: Authentication token, prefixed by Bearer: Bearer <token>
bearer.name: Authorization
